overview:
David Birnbaum, Chief Telecommunications Officer, oversees integration of Parlor with the public telephony and IP networks.

David has over 12 years of experience in managing and developing telecommunications access systems and 25 years experience with the Internet. He served as President and CEO of Public Interest Network Services, Inc. (PINS), a CLEC/wholesale provider of voice and data services, until April 2011. David has previously been the director of Distributed Systems for J. Crew, and a system architect and developer for Lehman Brothers, Morgan Stanley and ING Barings. He has a BS Chemistry and a BA Economics.
